website_summaries.verdict: If you have an especially large home, and absolutely need complete control over your personal Wi-Fi network, we cannot recommend the AC2600 highly enough.
pros: Expansive range of up to 14,000 square feet
Gigabit Ethernet port for lightning-fast direct connections
cons: The wide Wi-Fi range that this model projects and range of user-friendly features makes it a relatively expensive Wi-Fi extender

customer_reviews.title: Great product. Far exceeds my expectations.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this wifi extender with low expectations. I have a 3200 square foot house and thought I may need one for each floor. However, I am super happy I decided to try one at a time. Despite what I have read on some reviews, setting this thing up was a breeze and took maybe 10 minutes....max. I set it up for both bands. Then, I plugged it in on the same floor as my router and the range covers my entire house. No more dead spots and the speeds are much faster too. I couldn't be happier. As an added benefit, my wifi now extends far into my yard as well. Very happy.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony Pauley

customer_reviews.title: Be Aware of Poor Customer Service and Product Durability
customer_reviews.text: Bought the unit in May, 2018, worked great. Started having connection issues in Nov. Reboots initially helped, by mid Dec connection stopped. Reprogrammed the unit and it worked for about 5 minutes, then no connection. Contacted tp-links.....3 times via phone and could not get a person.....then tried email. Answered the same questions that included in my contact email and haven't heard from the since. It's been a fruitless effort to get any service or warranty action. Will Never buy another tp-links product, they have no customer service and don't honor their warranty.
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: Spotty useless device
customer_reviews.text: Powered on, connected, had multiple IP address issues. DHCP continued to turn on and off on its own. Took 5 resets to get DHCP from my network. Attempted dynamic IP, would not stick. Once I got it working my devices in turn had issues receiving an IP. Talked with support they said, restart setup from scratch each time....... Waste of time to have to restart process each time I walk in to a room that needed the Wifi extended. Installed an AP, fixed issue. Returned this product.
customer_reviews.author: J. Harvey

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with this purchase!
customer_reviews.text: We have Xfinity Cable & equipment and In the basement "man cave" we were only able to get 20mbps MAX due to the weak signal from the xfinity's modem most of the time it was much slower. After lots of research we ended up pulling the trigger on this device and I'm very happy we did. The Install was simple and easy using WPS with no issues. I tried both the wireless side (180mbps on average) with the Ethernet cable plugged into the PC from the TP-Link we get a consistent & legitimate 200+mbps!
customer_reviews.author: ClassicCoupe

customer_reviews.title: Extends your internet but also slows it down
customer_reviews.text: I've had this for about a year now and it was working fine up until the last firmware update. Im finding that my devices catch the signal but the signal is so poor that they drop out. And I added 20 devices on my network and now my other devices are getting throttled when on the same wifi. The device doesn't seem to handle multiple devices on its network. I had to unplug it so I can finally have decent internet speeds. I paid $150 when it was new, I expected a lot more from this device, so disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Ibrahim yusuf

customer_reviews.title: Major Disappointment
customer_reviews.text: I have used many extenders before, and this time we decided to buy something "more expensive" thinking it would work better in our household. We elected to use the same name as our main network for smooth transitions throughout the house like usual, and I'm telling you, since we bought this thing our connection has been super inconsistent. I have to "renew my lease" on my iPhone WiFi, or turn WiFi on and off, in order to get it back to normal more than 3-4 times each day. Once we removed it, our connection speed was doubled, back to expectations from the main router. Unfortunately it took us a few months to deduce that this was the issue.
customer_reviews.author: Mike D

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work with some hardware
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to extend my wireless around a metal hotspot in my house. I set it up, no problems, tested with my phone, no problems, actually really great results. Laptop for work, the reason I bought this in the first place, 5Ghz. . . no DNS resolution... 2.4Ghz really slow but resolution. Update firmware, same thing. Contact support, suppper slow responses, and no real fixes yet. If this is not solved today, I'll be returning this as I only wanted it for working from home, and it seems to be useless with my work-issued laptop. (HP 755 G5)
customer_reviews.author: shingold

customer_reviews.title: Not bad if it works.
customer_reviews.text: I got this hoping to extend the signal into my backyard. It does that for the most part, except it's not a continuous signal, so if you're on a zoom call or streaming, it will be interrupted when it reconnects to the extender and you'll be dropped from the call. That part I can live with, it's the 5ghz band not working after a couple of days that I can't accept. The 5ghz stopped connecting, even if I plug the extender next to the main router. No matter what I did, the 5ghz won't reconnect again, so that makes this basically useless.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan Meng-yeu Wang

customer_reviews.title: So far very impressed! I now finally have a good wi-fi signal far out into my yard for cameras!
customer_reviews.text: We just received this item and I had my 26 year old son set everything up. He is proficient with technology and said it was fairly easy to set up. Everything was working within an hour or so. We have surveillance cameras that require a good wi-fi signal, these cameras are a good 100 feet away and the signal is being sent through a very old house with solid wood walls. I really did not expect this to work. So far it's simply awesome and money well spent buying the more expensive of the products I was considering.
customer_reviews.author: Vilosity

customer_reviews.title: Make sure you buy it for the right purpose.
customer_reviews.text: Not good for hi volume data exchange like online gaming, or when you need to connect via a vpn for work. It does an excellent job extending, but do not expect the same level of speed, stability and data quality of you main router. For mobile phone use or connecting wireless streaming devices should be perfect. My sprinkler system controller in my garage connected and function perfectly. Was also nice to have wifi signal all over the yard outsidethe house.
customer_reviews.author: Jacques vM

customer_reviews.title: No no no no no no
customer_reviews.text: I gave this thing a year since purchasing before writing a review. It's fairly consistent...at being awful. I needed something to stop the buffering on our main television and extend our wifi signal on our first floor (also using a TP-Link router). I attempted using this as an extender plus the ethernet port was helpful. Unfortunately, it rarely worked. I received the same speeds as before. The range extender would often lose connection and need to be restarted (not easy, when it's behind a large television set in a wall cutout). I'd have to say - avoid this at all costs, unless you enjoy getting so frustrated that you smash a $125 piece of electronics into pieces.
customer_reviews.author: Slovak34

customer_reviews.title: It made things worse!
customer_reviews.text: I installed the Wi-fi range extender, following the directions I received. The extended range area had a slight improvement but the area that was already receiving a strong Wi-fi signal started having problems. My wife's phone and my iPad were apparently being pulled to the extender for a signal rather than the router resulting in a poor, unreliable signal. I tried moving to an outlet farther away, but the same problems occurred. When I disconnected the extender, the phone and iPad worked fine with a good signal again. I but a lot of things from Amazon, but it is very rare that I give a review score less than 3, but this product deserves a 1. DON'T BUY THIS PRODUCT!
customer_reviews.author: !!!Scott!!!

customer_reviews.title: Amazing product
customer_reviews.text: Its a TP Link. Its great. As a IT specialist, I recommend TP Link products. They offer much better security features than most. Very easy to set up and install. Plug in wifi booster near the main router. Download tether app, open it and locate / select the new TP Link you are setting up. Hit the WPS button on the router and the wifi booster and they sync up. Then you unplug it and plug it in where ever you need it. It will boot right up as long as it's in range of the main router. Power surge: once power restores, no set up is required. It will boot up on its own.
customer_reviews.author: Damon Garland

customer_reviews.title: Works Great with a non-Spectrum router
customer_reviews.text: Delivered the extended WiFi signal I needed after I replaced my Spectrum router. If you use Spectrum as your ISP and use one of their routers, it will connect to it, but you won’t get internet service. I discovered this after trying to get it to work and searching issues. It is an issue with Spectrum router firmware, NOT this produce. TP Link indicated they have done a firmware work around you can download. I opted to just save the monthly fee of the Spectrum router, and the hassle of it potentially not working if Spectrum upgrades its router, and replaced it with a TP Link router and loving the improvement!
customer_reviews.author: D. Williams

customer_reviews.title: Not worth $120!
customer_reviews.text: I bought it in May, and after a lot of fiddling, I got it up and running. It took over my internal internet password, so my connection procedure remained the same. This morning (Sep 21), it totally died. Resetting didn't work, so this will go into the trash and I'll have to reset everything. As my title said, not worth $120 on a bet. I'm sorry I ever bought it.
customer_reviews.author: Bob Renz

customer_reviews.title: Overall, really great! Just one small niggling issue
customer_reviews.text: Reading the instructions it was easy to setup the repeater and using the app on a tablet. Good signal, easy login. I concur with the statements on reviews and other tech websites this is a good product and does the job well. Wanted a wireless bridge with 4 Ethernet ports but 50% less cost and 1 Ethernet port is ok for now. Now, if the repeater can just only be designed so it doesn't block the other power receptacle, then I'll give it 5 stars. It'll be nice if the other power plug can be used. Idk, maybe a cord extension might make it work due to a smaller plug housing.
customer_reviews.author: HI@PNW

customer_reviews.title: Hell yeah!
customer_reviews.text: This fixed my dead zone issue! I had tried a 750 extender, but that was even slower than nothing. Put this thing by the back bedrooms and totally took care of my signal problems. I'm on a Linksys EA8500 Max-Stream AC2600 MU-MIMO Gigabit Router in a 1300 SF house. The router is all the way at one end in the living room. Dead zone was just in the opposite corner of the house in the back bedroom. This 2600 extender has the power to keep up.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan A. Cook

customer_reviews.title: It's ok.  Not great for wandering with phone/laptop.
customer_reviews.text: If you're trying to extend your signal for something like a tv or playstation, this works ok. But if you want it so that you can wander around your home with a phone or laptop, this won't work. Once a device has a signal, it tends to keep it until it's nearly dead, so the only way that I could get my phone or laptop to switch was to disconnect and reconnect to wifi each time which is a pain in the a$$. This is probably how extenders in general work so unless you don't care about phone/laptop connectivity and ease of use, a mesh network is definitely the way to go.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel M

customer_reviews.title: Poor performance
customer_reviews.text: Got this to extend the WiFi signal to the bedrooms to use for the TVs and Roku sticks. When it works the. It works fine. But at least once a week I have to reset it because it loses its signal. And then after it gets reset the signal quality isn’t as good. Not worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: KtKins

customer_reviews.title: The BEST one we have in our house!
customer_reviews.text: We've had about a dozen wi-fi access points in our (~4500 sq. ft) house over the years, and I can tell you this one is the BEST we've had so far. The range is great, seems fast, it is reliable (never goes down), and is easy to set up! It has an app that is very handy, and some nice features that some others didn't have, such as scheduling access times per device (handy for kids!). We have this plugged into a central location upstairs, and everyone can access it from anywhere in the house! If I ever need another one for a different location, I'm definitely buying this one again.
customer_reviews.author: HummingbirdsTop Contributor: Running

customer_reviews.title: Excellent WiFi Extender!
customer_reviews.text: Like most of you, I've been working from home during the COVID-19 situation. My home office is upstairs and quite a was from my Router. I was able to position this at the top of the stairs, between the router and office. The set-up is quite easy, but I would highly recommend throwing away the Quick Start sheet and just downloading the TP-Link Tether App. The App walks you through the set-up step by step. So now I'm getting a strong 5G signal in the home office making work flow so much better. Note that I didn't rate the Tech Support, cause I didn't need any.
customer_reviews.author: Soulcalsurfer

customer_reviews.title: TP-Link AC2600 are Great Extenders
customer_reviews.text: I have a 5000 square foot home and require extenders or a mesh to cover the footprint to include the garage, deck, and patio. I replaced my mesh router, which cause issues with older device that I owned. With a Synology router and two of the these devices I was able to cover these areas better than the mesh router. I did not lose any speed, despite my mesh router being pretty robust when it came to that. My kids complemented me on my choice, as they claim to experience better reception and speed in their bedrooms. Thanks TP-Link.
customer_reviews.author: kama_md

customer_reviews.title: This device is Junk
customer_reviews.text: After the full month of tech support trying to keep this device connected, I give up. I purchased it specifically to keep my Nest Hello connected with a strong signal. When it works it does just that, except I keep getting messages that my doorbell is offline because the TP-Link is down. Every other device is still working. I have crazy fast speed and strong signal. I picked this device because it got picked as a top extender on a view tech sites. I'm very disappointed. Oh yeah, and I have all those apps that tell you what channels on you router are best...yadda..yadda...this one is going back.
customer_reviews.author: Mick

customer_reviews.title: How is this product even getting positive reviews?
customer_reviews.text: The only thing good about this extender is that the setup was very easy - but I'd take a difficult setup process any day, if it meant my extender would work. I connected it to my firestick and laptop, and despite the the signal strength having all bars, the connection keeps getting cut off, and I mean it cuts off EVERY 3 minutes, if I'm even that lucky. And when it does finally connect, the speed is 'turtle mph'. Literally, I'm so frustrated that I could just throw it, but then I wouldn't be able to return it.
customer_reviews.author: Pheobe

customer_reviews.title: Not good
customer_reviews.text: I have 2300sq ft house with Fios internet so I would assume this extender would bring full speed from upstairs to downstairs but no... so slow. I need internet for Roku that is perpendicular from Fios router but TP-Link AC2600 didn’t help at all. I tried another brand before TP-link and it failed as well so maybe it’s the location of the room but it’s not even 40 feet away from the router, just downstairs. I didn’t try tech support, maybe next step
customer_reviews.author: white_lilac

customer_reviews.title: Seamless and fast
customer_reviews.text: With the COVID-19 crisis, we now have two adults working from home and three kids with online learning. Needless to say, we had a need for better wifi coverage throughout the house. I added the TP-Link at the recommendation of a friend. Once it arrived it was a seamless set-up with my current Netgear Nighthawk tri-band (wifi 5) router. The speed has been awesome and the integration into our network was simple. I highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Burton - Likes!

customer_reviews.title: Quick setup time and it's working well.
customer_reviews.text: I really like this Range Extender. It only took a few minutes to set up. It's simple and fast. I would have given 5 stars, but for some strange reason it didn't like the WPS method of configuring the unit. But it quickly responded to the online method and it only took a few minutes for the configuration for both the 2.4 and 5ghz bands to finalize. As far as the extender improving the area range and bandwidth strength in a dead spots in my home. It's working really well. I'll probably buy a couple more to enhance my WiFi around my pool and pavilion.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Won't connect to my network after 2-3 weeks
customer_reviews.text: When I first got it, it worked pretty well and increased my speed of my internet by 50 mbs. After couple of days or week it would struggle and ended up being slower than my normal internet. I would reset it and then it would be fine. Now it won't connect to my network at all. I always use TP-Link products and they are usually great. I would stay away from this one.
customer_reviews.author: Gibran C.

customer_reviews.title: Garbage
customer_reviews.text: I have a small 750-sq-ft apartment, and wanted to use this to extend and strengthen the 5GHz WiFi signal from the TP Link router in the living room to my desk, located down a hallway in my bedroom. Unfortunately, this extender is literally worse than nothing. Without it, my laptop gets about 50 Mbps over my 5GHz network. With it, I get less: 30 Mbps. That's right, using this network extender makes the WiFi signal 40% WORSE. I have spent hours online with TP Link tech support, and even received a new unit from them. It didn't help.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Hardee

customer_reviews.title: nice extender
customer_reviews.text: unit is good for adding strength to WiFi in the home. Goes a great job, easy set-up. Not sure if local issue or not, been unable to increase the strength of 5 Gz band one from Nighthawk 3200 router. 2.5 and 5 Band 2 were pumped up esp to remote location of home, not band 1 that stays about 1/2 strength except at nearest router location
customer_reviews.author: Paul D

customer_reviews.title: It works pretty well so far for my 5Ghz signal.
customer_reviews.text: I tried quite a few brands/models of Wi-Fi extender, but this one seems to work the best, and I think it's worth my money. My wireless router is located in my living room, and my main problem is my bed room is only 35 feet away. My 5Ghz signal is very week and usually the 2.4Ghz signal will pick up better, but that's slow as we all know. With this in the middle my 5Ghz is all the way up and now it's constantly on. I definitely recommend to give it a try.
customer_reviews.author: David L.

customer_reviews.title: Vertical signal?
customer_reviews.text: Got this to boost our WiFi signal in our 2-story house. I can now stream in the basement (router on 2nd floor) without interruption. I still use LTE on my phone in the basement, but tablet and computer do well. The speed boost is not insignificant, but not what it could be. I did move the device around 2-3 times after setup to find the best location. It has increase speed of devices on the main floor and patio, which is a definite plus. So, my only complaint is that it could be better in the vertical direction, but it really does a fine job.
customer_reviews.author: Colbc

customer_reviews.title: After just a year and a half, it drops signal CONSTANTLY
customer_reviews.text: This worked GREAT for the first year or so. Now, though - I have to take it downstairs to where the router is at least twice per week because it loses the signal somehow. Plugging it in nearby seems to clear the issue for a few days (sometimes just a few minutes). I've tried resetting the device twice and that helps it to work for a little bit longer, but it is NOT worth the exorbitant price after only working for a short period of time!
customer_reviews.author: ErinP

customer_reviews.title: First time easy..this time not easy
customer_reviews.text: I got this when I had dsl weak signal from att.....got tired of slow speeds and got cable....comcast...trying to set this up again has become a real ordeal...not sure why it does not send internet with the new channels....my poor laptop cannot connect to the internet via either channel...tried to use tether...it changed to one channel and named it for me...trying to use that and there is no internet in that channel....reset many times....read many articles..turned off the firewall...did not have any problems the first time but this one has been really hard, lots of hours, no success..so I guess the best review is sometimes it works as it should and sometimes it just does not....
customer_reviews.author: Dr. Mary Gresham

customer_reviews.title: Worth the purchase
customer_reviews.text: I have Xfinity WiFi and added 2 Netgear routers to extend WiFi in my home. This created a problem of needing to switch between WiFi networks, plus I had periodic reliability issues with 1 of the routers. In doing research, Xfinity notes that TP-Link WiFi extenders are compatible with their router. I bought to give it a try and works well. Up and running in 5 mins, using the same WiFi network as Xfinity (no more switching). My wife who complained the most said she noticed a significant difference in WiFi when she is upstairs (problem area). I’m buying a second and removing the Netgear routers. I would recommend to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: chino1978

customer_reviews.title: Very reliable: fast and wide range
customer_reviews.text: I've tried 4 different WiFi Range Extender and they all had problems with the range or far almost strong speed drops. Due to the prices around 30-50 USD no surprise, I guess. Now, after investing a big amount into the topic I am happy that I really receive nearly 100 mbits and more in the whole apartment. This item makes a good impression in terms of physical quality and user experience. I can really recommend it... and in case I will have some issues within the next months, I gonna update this review. I hope this helps everyone who is looking for a solid product.
customer_reviews.author: lente

customer_reviews.title: Works until it doesn't
customer_reviews.text: If stability is not an issue, by all means this is the unit for you. It's easy to set up and does a great job until it decides to stop working and reboot itself. You'll be in the middle of an important Zoom call and just like that, your connection is gone. You look down to see the blue ring flashing red, which Customer Service says is due to your router sending a weak wifi signal. It does this intermittently with no warning. I've reset it more times than I can count and no matter what it just doesn't hold up. Firmware is up to date. Wish I could return it and try another brand.
customer_reviews.author: Todd B

customer_reviews.title: Spend the money on a high end extender-WELL worth it!
customer_reviews.text: Pricey but worth it. I have had 4 different extenders in my 4100 sq ft home over the last few months. This is the FIRST one that has had ZERO issues with connectivity or strength. The programming is cool also because I have the LEDS turn off at night (they are bright and this is in a hallway with bedrooms). On a side note, it would make a great nightlight also. I'm glad I bought the bullet and ate the big bucks on this one. It has zero lag and speed tests as fast as the main cable modem that it is extending. It even throws the signal strong outside (this was a hidden plus).
customer_reviews.author: Bass Face

customer_reviews.title: When it works, it works great
customer_reviews.text: I have to restart it every 2 to 3 days. Sometimes, it acts as if it is clogged. Funny thing is that when I check the signal, it tells me that it could be farther from the router. Is it my network? No. I can jump onto the other SSID which does not use the repeater and it acts normal. This is supposed to be the best repeater and have tried everything, except a mesh. Tech support is going to say it is my modem (which is a new modem).
customer_reviews.author: Ratatouie

customer_reviews.title: Very Dissapointed
customer_reviews.text: Received in May 2020 and originally after one month of use, I was pleased with the extender. It is now August 2020, and it stopped working. It has power however only the power light is on. I have tried all ways recommended in the instruction booklet that came in the box and it just will not connect. I purchased this item for $99 plus tax and I'm very disappointed in this product after 3 months of use. I can not return it because I only had one month from the date of purchase. This is not right.
customer_reviews.author: E. Quintanilla

customer_reviews.title: Covers two outlets; good speeds with fiddly setup.
customer_reviews.text: Needed to get something to increase bandwidth in my home office on the 2nd floor of my townhouse. Speeds of the unit are good, but the setup took some fiddling with; the directions for setup are rather sparse. This sucker is also big enough that it covers two outlets, making it a bit cumbersome to place. In my case, plugging it into an outlet meant that I couldn't have a power strip also plugged in there. Annoying but not a deal breaker.
customer_reviews.author: Mat Bradley-Tschirgi

customer_reviews.title: Frustrating Beyond Words
customer_reviews.text: I was excited to receive this to extend coverage to my deck. Despite almost 6 hours with customer support over 3 days via chat the extender would not work at all. First, it came with out dated firmware It slowed my internet speed to the point where normal web pages wouldn’t load. My internet speed is excellent without the extender. The chats were brutally slow. It took forever for them to answer each question. The endless suggestions never made a difference. It seemed that they were going in circles. The instructions in the links they sent were hard to understand. I returned it and am looking for an extender that works
customer_reviews.author: anna volaric

customer_reviews.title: Constantly needs re-booting
customer_reviews.text: These work great - for approximately 12 hours. Then will randomly disconnect, drop devices and indicate that their is no internet, or work at very low speeds. Re-booting fixes the problem, but I have ended up needing to do this every morning - and yes I tried everything that I could to fix this (latest firmware etc). Don't buy this - find an alternative.
customer_reviews.author: Kate

customer_reviews.title: Must have for ring products!
customer_reviews.text: Used it on my second ring flood light cam which had an RSSI of -66 and video was not fluid. Installed this TP-Link | AC2600 Wifi Extender and had my flood light cam connect to it and the RSSI value is now -54!!!!!!! Now has fluid video.. This product works as described and setup via web browser was super simple. This is a MUST have item if have ring products far way from your Ring Chime Pro extender or router. Buy with confidence!!! Highly recommended!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Joi

customer_reviews.title: Dropping in Millington
customer_reviews.text: This was simple to install, but I’m not seeing any real significant differences in our strength. Now I don’t have a physical test that says it is now 20% stronger etc, but I’m going by dropped calls...still have them, loss of signal...still have it....same places?... yes!! When you pay $$$! You expect to get-ABC!!
customer_reviews.author: JAHarris

customer_reviews.title: Powerful, easy to setup, looks sleek
customer_reviews.text: And boom, just like that the back end of my home has 90% gain in signal. No more lost, dropped signals. Heck I can even venture out into my back yard and around my house without any issues streaming my music and I have aluminum siding! Kids are happy, Xbox, streaming tvs, phones, tablets etc... No problems in this house anymore. Absolutely recommend and I have $400 router, you'd think that would be enough.
customer_reviews.author: Shawn Young

customer_reviews.title: You Get What You Pay For.
customer_reviews.text: WOW! I have tried 2 other extenders with absolutely no luck. My house is over 7000 square feet and I had just about given up hope of getting Wi-Fi at the opposite end of house from where the modem is placed, that is until using this TP Link Extender. I can actually get a strong signal at my next door neighbors house on the opposite end of where the modem is located!
customer_reviews.author: Alvin

customer_reviews.title: Just false advertisement - DO NOT WASTE YOUR MONEY
customer_reviews.text: My old NETGEAR Dual-Band Wi-Fi Range Extender is better than this expensive extender. No brainer $40 or $120? Geee, whatta waste of money. Update: I decide to update the firmware and it got worse. It connects for couple of hours then disconnects again. Just wasted my time and money for this piece of crap
customer_reviews.author: Dr0pZ0n3

customer_reviews.title: Poor signal strength
customer_reviews.text: Ordered this WiFi extender hoping to obtain much stronger signal for streaming video services; ie, netflix, amazon, hulu, etc. however after installing and setting up the extender service was only marginal better. Continued to experience buffering on most streaming services even though I had placed it with 5 feet of a Samsung smart tv. Would not buy again as I am certain there are stronger and more reliable wifi extenders at a cheaper price.
customer_reviews.author: Don't Worry, Bee Happy

customer_reviews.title: THE LIGHTS ON THE FRONT.
customer_reviews.text: I have this extender and it is very nice, as other users say, I read other users say that the lights are very bright in which they do, some say you can turn them by the switch on the side in which you can, but if you have the app installed on your phone, you can go into tools and setup the Day and night schedule that you want it to come on in the morning and the time you want it to go off at night and it will do that, you won’t have to turn it on and off manually, PS HOPE I AM HELPFUL TO THOSE THAT DON’t KNOW.
customer_reviews.author: andy

customer_reviews.title: I would buy again
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for our 200,000 sq ft warehouse which had a dead spot on one end. The area that needed a boost in signal is about 25,000 sq feet. I place the tp-link about 140 ft away from the laptop needing wifi and it resulted in a full signal strength. Wow, I'm impressed! Set up was fairly easy and took about 5 min. I'm not sure about reliability since it was just purchased but I can say that it performs better than expected, especially for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Driz

customer_reviews.title: Gives Strong Internet Signals.  Well Worth the Money.
customer_reviews.text: Works well in my NY apartment. I share the wireless with the neighbor one floor below me in a New York City apartment building. The router is downstair. By the time the signal reaches my bedroom, it is very weak in some spots and non-existent in others. I install this extender, and the signal is now full bar every where in the apartment. It gives strong internet signal in spots that I couldn't get signals before. Glad I got it. Save a lot of money on internet service. Definitely a good buy!
customer_reviews.author: tom nyc

customer_reviews.title: Not good enough but the only choice available so far for MU MIMO
customer_reviews.text: Only because the linksys RE7000 from review cannot reconnect automatically. The RE650 is bulky and weighs too much. The speed of RE650 is great but it has significant initial latency when viewing a different web site, sometimes causes the web site to show "cannot be loaded". It also dynamically assigns new MAC addresses, which makes MAC filtering difficult.
customer_reviews.author: satisfied person, depends

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money
customer_reviews.text: this extender worked fine for the first 4-5 months, but after that it soon began to "disconnect" itself. It would reconnect if we were there to go through the process, but if you are out of town and hope to secure your home with video cameras you can forget this. And now I can't even get it to manually reset. Do not buy this if you want something that will work well. I could understand having problems after a few years, but within 6 months is rediculous. very dissapointed and I'd return it if I could.
customer_reviews.author: Cheri Newman

customer_reviews.title: Does not support band steering!
customer_reviews.text: If you set up your router to use band steering (to automatically switch between 2.4g and 5g bands) than this will refuse to connect to, but will extend 2.4g network, resulting in your device dropping connection for some time. Especially frustrating if you rely on connections to remote machines. EDIT: Got it fixed by updating the firmware and setting the channels of both bands to what the extender was trying to connect. in my case those were 11 for 2.4g and 36 for 5g.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not a great experience in my home . . .
customer_reviews.text: Easy to follow setup, but would frequently lose primary connection (despite strong signal present), so you connect to the extender but then no Internet connection - cured by power off/on. First tp-link product I have owned that has not been fit for purpose - shame the return window has passed - my patience didn't pay off with this one. Tried it using same SSID and also using different SSID, same SSID was a disaster, so quickly went to it's own SSID and that was better just inconsistent (2.5 and 5 bands). I now have Eero mesh - and that works great, bit pricey but worth it for no re-boots!
customer_reviews.author: PJ

customer_reviews.title: Installation not consistent with directions in package.
customer_reviews.text: It installed easily enough at first, but the 5G never linked up. I followed the alternative directions to configure the 5G. This NEVER worked. The first step was this thing was supposed to set up a service WiFi connection. This was never even shown on my laptop, phone, or iPad. Not on my kids laptops. Nowhere. I never configured the 5G boost. Not as important in our house as the 2.4 GHz so I'm OK with the product. It's just frustration to work for half an hour trying to work through the directions and they're just wrong.
customer_reviews.author: Shayne Bennett

customer_reviews.title: No.  Just NO.
customer_reviews.text: Bought 2 of these. Neither would stay linked to my AC2600 Synology Router (top of the line) and neither would connect to router at 5Ghz but only 2.4. Both dropped broadcast signal multiple time per day. Gave them a week and reinstalled half dozen times. Also both extenders download speeds maxed out at about 5Mbs and my router downloads between 100 Mbs and 180 Mbs. NO THANK YOU. What a waste of time. JUNK.
customer_reviews.author: Babel Phaedrus

customer_reviews.title: Worth the Cost
customer_reviews.text: I wanted this extender to get better WiFi throughout my 1-acre yard and this extender fit the bill. I have it plugged in just inside the door to my backyard and easily get signal in all areas with virtually no 'drops.' I was reluctant to spend this much for the extender, but happy I did.
customer_reviews.author: Chris D.

customer_reviews.title: Takes a little bit of setting up, the app is helpful, Strong signal. But.....
customer_reviews.text: Takes a little bit of setting up, the app is helpful, Strong signal. But..... I have found some issues with it after a while. My printer kept losing wifi connection when it went to sleep. My Dish "Joeys" also could not connect to Hopper when Hopper was linked to this. When I connected back to direct wifi from router, all issues stopped. So, this does indeed work well as an extender, but might cause a few glitches. Reducing to 3 stars from 4.
customer_reviews.author: JSMCO

customer_reviews.title: Pricey----but worth it.
customer_reviews.text: Got to tell you, truthfully this is a little pricey in my opinion. But the reviews were solid, and I had an 18 year old teenager gaming and streaming like mad!!! Then I bought 2-- 4k televisions that required a much better signal for streaming. So I thought I would take a chance. Glad I did. This has helped us maintain a pretty strong signal 90% of the time. Much better than before. I appreciate the improvement, and feel it has paid for itself in lack of aggravation!!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install, awesome wifi coverage, best extender I've tried
customer_reviews.text: I'm not a 'tech savvy' person, but this was super easy to install and sync with my home wifi. I'm replacing a Netgear extender that never quite did the job. I have the TP-Link extender 30-35' from my router, mounted high on a wall in my utility room and now have a good wifi signal in my shop... a building that's 60' from the extender!!! The signal is strong enough that I can watch Netflix on that TV now!
customer_reviews.author: M Simpson

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Wifi Extender & Easy to setup
customer_reviews.text: I'm staying in an AirBnB and the walls are really thick. The Wifi signal strength is about half of full strength which is affecting our download and upload speeds. I installed this Wifi extender and our signal is at full and our speeds more than doubled! Basically, now that we have this Wifi extender, we can reap the full speed of the Wifi network where before, our poor signal was giving us a slow speed and intermittent connection drops.
customer_reviews.author: Steven Ayers

customer_reviews.title: I could not get this item to work at all
customer_reviews.text: Despite 50 years as a computer scientist and many tries over about 3 days, I could never get the tp-link to be set up and working. When I went to the web for info, even that didn't help. I can't tell if it's their software setup or that the device is simply not working. I have given up and gone for a different solution to extending the wifi in our home.
customer_reviews.author: J. Mitchell

customer_reviews.title: Best extender I have ever owned.
customer_reviews.text: Does an exceptional job and extending both the 2.4 ghz and 5.0 ghz signals. My modem is down stairs north side of the house and the extender is up stairs on the south side-about as far away as it can be, and its significantly increase the strength of the signal. Set up is a breeze too.
customer_reviews.author: eli catt

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Product
customer_reviews.text: This product is a life saver. I ordered it because the WiFi connection in my basement was very weak. Plus, I have a lot of video conferences throughout the day and I frequently get a message stating that my internet signal is unstable. An IT professional recommended this and it is a true life saver. I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: music lover

customer_reviews.title: Great...once you upgrade the firmware.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install and setup but for whatever reason, this product still has a firmware that is 1.0. Until I upgraded the firmware, I was having packet drops like other reviewers, but once upgraded, works like a champ. I would suggest to TP-Link to ship the device with the latest firmware...
customer_reviews.author: Ed

customer_reviews.title: Improved Blink's Performance.
customer_reviews.text: Had some trouble with the latency (lag time) when the Blink security camera when it was activated waiting as long as 30 seconds to view the video using a Netgear WiFi extender. Not that the Netgear (EX2700) extender was bad but the WIFI extender just wasn't for the lack of better word "powerful" enough to handle that type of video steaming. The TP-Link | AC2600 solved that issue. Alerts and views are now pretty much instantaneous while going to live view takes about 5-8 seconds. In A.P. mode (Access Point) it seems even faster. I plan on keeping it in A.P. mode once I get some cat-5 cable. Not cheap but it did solve my problem.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. G

customer_reviews.title: They work great. This Range Extender did not give me the ...
customer_reviews.text: I have a house full of TP-Link Wi-Fi bulbs, that I control using the KASA app. They work great. This Range Extender did not give me the wifi range I had hoped to get. I called their technical help line and they tried to get it to work, but they never could. I also tried changing my wifi channels with my internet service provider. This was my experience, but you could have a better one. I have their Power Line Adapter and it works great.
customer_reviews.author: Sunshine State Lady

customer_reviews.title: TP-Link review
customer_reviews.text: We decided to buy this product so that we would be able to get WiFi in our back yard and it gets the job done. The biggest problem that it has created is affect our internet speed and causes our router networks to stop working. We lasted a week without having the network extender on and the internet was fine and our phones never lost connection. We plug the TP-link extender and the problems started occurring again. We’ve tried different setups but it still creates those problems I mentioned before.
customer_reviews.author: Eduardo

customer_reviews.title: Another junk product through Amazon
customer_reviews.text: It constantly needs to be rebooted and disconnects from the TPL router. Freaking junk!!! I was looking for something to stabilize my WiFi network and this has just made things worse. As a consumer you would think I could purchase an extender made by the same company and it would be seamless in its connection to the router but that’s not been the case. Waste of hard earned money and making me think twice about purchasing items like this from Amazon any longer
customer_reviews.author: Philip Evans

customer_reviews.title: Works terribly with Nighthawk Netgear router
customer_reviews.text: This product apparently was not coded for vendor interoperability. I have a Nighthawk AC2600 Router that is rock solid. As soon as I added this WiFi extender, I noticed the WiFi drop for a solid 2-3 seconds when handing off and taking over as the BSS area for my mobile devices. I've read other reviews of people who have TP-Link routers with no issues. Although I can't verify the former comments since I have a Netgear, I would say If you have a non TP-Link routers, stay away from this model.
customer_reviews.author: TechReview

customer_reviews.title: Great product - easy to install
customer_reviews.text: I bought to extend my WIFI and to allow my daughter to assist their on-line classes in their own bedroom. It was easy to install, even if it's quite tricky to find the right location and distance from my Verizon router. Finally it works. My daughters can assist their classroom with the camera on.
customer_reviews.author: Franck

customer_reviews.title: Great if you setup your own router
customer_reviews.text: The options available are very nice. Being able to clone your SSID from your router or set-up an original one is nice. The fact that is has separate options for 2.4 and 5 Ghz modes is handy. Adding this to our single router, allows me to completely cover my 3,000 sqft house with no gaps and no drops in signal strength. The only downside is that setup is a bit cumbersome if you don't download the app.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Judkins

customer_reviews.title: Works well and easy to setup
customer_reviews.text: Very simple to setup and works very well in our home. We now have coverage in a room that was unable to get wi-fi coverage. I liked it enough to order an additional unit to help with streaming video to one of our TVs.
customer_reviews.author: Dan and TalTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Increased the signal
customer_reviews.text: I bought this higher priced unit hoping for better results. Installation and programming took a bit longer than anticipated. Once it hooked up and started running, the 2.4ghz hooked up but the 5.0 ghz never hooked up to this day. After hooking up I received 4 out of 5 bars of signal strength in the far corner room of our house compared to only 1 bar before. But for some reason, it drops the signal completely and takes a long time to reconnect.
customer_reviews.author: Jerod

customer_reviews.title: Failed
customer_reviews.text: Doesn't connect automatically to any devices so it has to be done manually every time. I followed the setup instructions, but the 5Ghz LED on the device never illuminated, but did appeared as a WiFi option. Also major latency. It was too frustrating so I returned it.
customer_reviews.author: Binh Nguyen

customer_reviews.title: Not so good
customer_reviews.text: My previous rating was a little better but after having this device it seems like its starting to act up, so my review is going to change, its seems that the extender is not getting the signal it used to, it slowed down drastically, connects to my phone with a strong signal but keeps buffering, if I switch to LTE it works great, Im not sure I can return it since it was purchased In December
customer_reviews.author: Vic

customer_reviews.title: impressively simple and powerful device
customer_reviews.text: (network IT engineer for a living) this device amazed me. for the price and the performance I did not just buy one for my home, but also have installed them in 3 friends homes where the wifi needed to be relayed hundreds of feet away. this device did the trick almost too well and easily. keeping in mind do not place it behind concrete walls and/or too many obstacles give it as clean of a path to the area you need to get the signal and it does so very well. yes, you will lose some speed depending how far away and how many walls are in between, that is just the nature of how this works.
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: It’s a hassle getting it to work again & again
customer_reviews.text: It initially worked well. Although I had some issues setting it up with both my 2.4 & 5 ghz connections, I just kept resetting it & somehow eventually got it to work even though I did nothing differently. It worked well for a few weeks, then I started to notice that only the 2.4 was working. Multiple times I would reset it and it would finally get it to work for both again. This happened multiple times and now after resetting it, it does not work with both 2.4&5 for more than a day. I have had to reset it multiple times & it’s just too time consuming at this point. Don’t buy this, it’s a pain in the ass.
customer_reviews.author: j

customer_reviews.title: Worst Product Ever!
customer_reviews.text: Installation is a nightmare with minimal support from web site and chat support. I am a computer expert and this product and its "Easy Installation" is totally worthless. After 20 Plus attempts to install, reset and install and restore and install, it still does not make a network connection. Save your money and hours of frustration, do not buy this piece of junk.
customer_reviews.author: Gary T. Miller

customer_reviews.title: Works well so far
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had FOUR different extenders in the past year and a half and good Lord, they were always working, not working.... The router is in a room with a window about 60’ away from window where extenders were plugged into (with no trees or other objects in the way other than the walls of the building and house) and they were constantly not connecting. Sometimes they’d work, but mostly not. So far, this TP-Link AC2600 has worked every time we turn on YouTube or Netflix in the garage since I got it. Fingers crossed it lasts! The garage tv is essential for the adults to look up hilarious & inappriate content while the kids watch kid stuff inside.
customer_reviews.author: Greenfield

customer_reviews.title: This is a powerful, well-designed, easy-to-use device.
customer_reviews.text: After reading lots of reviews in various publications, I decided to get this range extender over a few of the other top-rated range extenders. I'm 100% satisfied and happy with this purchase. It took just a few minutes to set up. Very intuitive and easy. It works perfectly. I now have strong wifi where there was previously almost no signal. I highly recommend this range extender.
customer_reviews.author: Suzy M.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent device. just read the instructions.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this because we were struggling to get a wifi signal on our lower level. Works great, as long as you read the instructions and pick a good install location. We had to place it on the upper level near the stair, not down where we were having the issue. Since installing we have not had issues with WIFI downstairs. One thing to note is that it sets up a seperate wifi network, so we have one to log into upstairs and downstairs. Once we set up both on devices they are all smart enough to reconnect to one or the other as you move throughout the house.
customer_reviews.author: Sam00

customer_reviews.title: This product is horrible.
customer_reviews.text: This product is piece of crap. It advertised as one network, but I was forced to change the network name. It keeps dropping my connected devices and even the devices that are connected doesn’t get internet. Some do and most don’t. I have tried calling tech support several times and have been on hold for more than half hour. When I finally connected with tech support they wasted over TWO hours of my time and dropping my call TWICE they asked me to update the firmware. I DON’T recommend this product because you’re on your own if something goes wrong with it!!
customer_reviews.author: Farida

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy! TP-link Keeps disconnecting!
customer_reviews.text: I wanted like this WiFi extender. I tried it for many days, resetting it multiple time hoping that might make it finally work. But alas, I need to return it. It works fine for almost a day, then it disconnects from the WiFi router. My 7 year old Netgear extender keeps its connection better, although it’s slower. Both 2.4 & 5ghz disconnect. I had tried a RE 450 and the 2.4G would disconnect. I don’t think I’ll buy another TP-link product.
customer_reviews.author: lephantom

customer_reviews.title: Do Not Purchase  -  Amazon and the TP-Link never called back for support -
customer_reviews.text: Chat line with Paul from Amazon and he said he would call the manufacture and call back in two to three hours. The manufacture didn’t call and Amazon called the next day. The product Does Not Work and no support. Worthless piece of junk. It shuts off randomly. Never worked correctly. Big disappointment with Amazon Support and TP-Link. I would look for a different manufacturer Additionally I’m still waiting. 3rd request and for a chat or email. Amazon has a record of two answered phone calls where Amazon dropped the ball and the manufacture does Not Care. Absolutely stay clear of this product. It does not work without resetting and no help. Buyer beware!
customer_reviews.author: Steve Bicknell

customer_reviews.title: Great WiFi coverage, horrible 5ghz support
customer_reviews.text: The signal strength is great. Reaches all my upstairs bedrooms, even though it’s installed downstairs. Biggest complaint is that the 5ghz band is worthless. Half the time it doesn’t show in my list of available connections. Devices that are connected to it, lose connection constantly. If they could fix this, it would easily be 5 stars. Maybe a smaller form factor would be better as well, but that’s not a big deal.
customer_reviews.author: Vustadumas

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t work for homes with thick walls.
customer_reviews.text: I would not recommend this product for those who have older buildings with thick walls. I live in a 3200 sq ft one story condo built in the 1920s. While installation was easy and I had full bars in almost every room, the wifi dropped every 2-3 minutes, requiring me to turn my WiFi on and off every single time on all my devices. This product did not work for me.
customer_reviews.author: Joanne Molinaro

customer_reviews.title: Easy to set up
customer_reviews.text: This range extender took about 15 minutes to set up, most of that was reading the quick setup manual. Best of all is that it extended the Wi-Fi signal into an area of the house that previously had only one bar. I gave this device four stars for tech support only because the more advanced features were only described online. Otherwise, it would have been five stars all around.
customer_reviews.author: RgA

customer_reviews.title: IMPORTANT! Get the new firmware to protect from a vulnerability.
customer_reviews.text: I cannot include links, but search for "Critical RCE Vulnerability in TP-Link Wi-Fi Extenders Can Grant Attackers Remote Control" to find IBM's article about a this and related products. Go to TP-Link's product page for this item on their web site and get the latest firmware. RE650(US)_V1_190521 Published Date: 2019-05-30 Language: Multi-language File Size: 6.83 MB Modifications: 1.Fixed CVE-2019-7406 discovered by IBM to increase security.
customer_reviews.author: Choda Boy

customer_reviews.title: A must-have!
customer_reviews.text: A must-have! I have tried several different router extenders and receivers and none have ever compared to the AC2600! We have a Mother in Law's Suite on our property and after calling our phone/cable company, we decided it would be too expensive to install Wi-Fi and TV. I was hesitant to purchase this because, in the past, no other extender has worked... even for the main house. This not only boosted signal to the Suite, but it also made the spotty places in our home Wi-Fi accessible. I know its pricier than most but it is definitely worth it. The little robot arms are easily adjustable and set up is a breeze!
customer_reviews.author: Emily

customer_reviews.title: Not as easy as they say.
customer_reviews.text: The WPS installation did not work. Then I try the app (suggested) and had confusing instructions. I also try youtube and could not find a solution. Finally, someone from technical support send me a link to a video that had very specific instructions. Why don't they give the video on the first time?
customer_reviews.author: Johnny Rivera

customer_reviews.title: great product for the money
customer_reviews.text: products works great , after reviewing many this one was it. Be careful with other products signing to allow them to monitor your item. This one did not need to be signed for third party. Signal is stron and since install did not have any issues.works great.exactly what I was looking for, since I have many in the household that are streaming and playing video games.
customer_reviews.author: Frank

customer_reviews.title: immediately above and below the product location works best. Oddly enough
customer_reviews.text: AC2600 has connectivity issues (frequently dropping signal so all connected devices loses internet connectivity). When it does work, immediately above and below the product location works best. Oddly enough, the Wi-Fi range extender drops/loses connectivity in all other directions. Example: TV/Computer located less than 2 feet away from the device loses connectivity, while TV/Laptop immediately downstairs from the device (roughly 14 feet away) has great connectivity.
customer_reviews.author: Yo

customer_reviews.title: Poor documentation will drive you crazy.
customer_reviews.text: The seller and manufacturer are irresponsible and not following basic guidelines for documentation, which leads to a frustrating experience. I could not find a troubleshooting section in the box or online, and was left up in the air when the gadget did not work. There is confusing wording in the printed instructions that smacks of amateur.
customer_reviews.author: Naomi

customer_reviews.title: TP-Link AC2600 Works as Specified
customer_reviews.text: The TP-Link AC2600 works as specified. I first installed it using WiFi and it provided me with the speed and coverage I was looking for. I then hardwired it as a Access Port and the speed was excellent. The unit is very easy to configure but I did have issues with the 5GB because of the Verizon Router I’m using but I was able to get it fully working in 30 minutes.
customer_reviews.author: SBK

customer_reviews.title: Very Difficult to get to work with Apple Time Capsule
customer_reviews.text: after 3-4 hours of trying to make it work and internet research I gave up and returned it. Could never get a 5 Ghz signal. Instructions are worthless if you have a Apple product.
customer_reviews.author: Kathy Ernst

customer_reviews.title: Buy with confidence! This product is amazing!
customer_reviews.text: This extender is amazing. For those who wrote a review- thank you. Those reviews helped with the decision to purchase this. There were dead spots in my house but after installing this, the signal is strong and has extended much further. I did need to call the tech support to get assistance with the set up; I was set up within 5-10 minutes once they assist me. Again, buy with confidence!
customer_reviews.author: KAYJ

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Tech Support
customer_reviews.text: It works great! The 5g isn't that great, however. My ring wouldn’t work with my old extender. I can around the house without trouble. I’m not sure how to use the app that well. It is more complicated than I thought to set up. But it works. Tech support set it up for me over the phone. They did all the work.
customer_reviews.author: jesse

product_meta.title: TP-Link AC2600 WiFi Extender, Up to 2600Mbps, Dual Band WiFi Range Extender, Gigabit port, Repeater, Access Point, 4x4 MU-MIMO, Easy Set-Up, Extends Internet Wifi to Smart Home Devices(RE650)
product_meta.description: Model:AC2600Extend high-performance Wi-Fi across your home to remove dead zones, drop outs and spotty signal with the RE650 Wi-Fi range extender. Wave 2 Dual-Band with 4-stream and Turbo create Fast AC2600 Wi-Fi connections so you can enjoy watching 4K movies and gaming without lag in any room. Mu-mimo lets the RE650 talk to many devices at once to reduce wait times and speed up connections. Match the RE650 with an MU-MIMO router to amplify performance over extended Wi-Fi. The intelligent processing engine seamlessly manages each Wi-Fi band and every connection while four powerful antennas boost Wi-Fi coverage across your home. Frequency Range: 2.4GHz & 5GHz(11ac); Interface Available: 1 x 10/100/1000M Ethernet Port (RJ45); Protocols Supported: IEEE802.11ac IEEE 802.11n IEEE 802.11g IEEE 802.11b IEEE 802.11a; System Requirement: Microsoft Windows 98SE NT 2000 XP Vista or Windows 7 8 10 Mac OS NetWare UNIX or Linux.
feature_bullets: Extend the range of your Wi Fi with the dual band RE650, compatible with any type of Router / Gateway / Access Point ( 2.4GHz 800Mbps / 5GHz 1733Mbps)
Quad Antenna design for ultimate coverage for all areas of your home

MU-MIMO Wave 2 technology allows the RE650 to talk to Multiple devices at once for optimal Performance between devices. Beamforming Technology sends targeted Wi Fi signal to individual devices for stronger connections.
Smart indicator lights help provide optimal placement. Should be installed between the Router and the desired area.
Gigabit Ethernet port connects wired devices to your network for high speed connection
Easy to install Experience stable connections for any type of applications such as Retail POS, Internet, Gaming, Mobile phone, Alexa, Echo and more
All WiFi extenders are designed to increase or improve WiFi coverage, not to directly increase speed. In some cases improving signal reliability can affect overall throughput.
If you experience any trouble during or after set up, please contact us. TP-Link offers a 2 year warranty and Free 24/7 technical support

specifications.Hardware Platform: Microsoft Windows 98SE, NT, 2000, XP, Vista or Windows 7, 8, 10, Mac OS, NetWare, UNIX or Linux
specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.9 out of 5 stars11,054 ratings3.9 out of 5 stars
